image.altText: PM in akubra hat smiling as he sits next to indigenous elder Pat Dodson.

props.synopsis: Former senator Pat Dodson says Anthony Albanese "was smart not to drink from the poisoned chalice" in stepping back from reconciliation efforts after the failed Voice referendum.

title.children: 'Poisoned chalice': Dodson gets why Albanese backed away from Indigenous issues

image.altText: Police officers in high-viz clothing stand near ambulances in the street after an incident at a parade

props.synopsis: Local police say a man has been detained after reports of a road traffic collision in Liverpool's city centre.

title.children: Car hits pedestrians attending Liverpool Premier League celebrations

image.altText: Exterior signage at Hobart Private Hospital.

props.synopsis: Australia's second-largest private hospital operator, which runs 37 hospitals across the country and employs about 19,000 people, has appointed receivers.

title.children: Healthscope collapses into receivership

image.altText: A digital drawing of Erin Patterson wearing a pink shirt

props.synopsis: An investigator looking into a deadly 2023 lunch told the court that details in Ms Patterson's account of events changed over the course of several conversations.

title.children: Health official says Erin Patterson’s account of deadly lunch changed

image.altText: A woman looks over a charred and burnt out car in a residential car park.

props.synopsis: The Kremlin says people are beginning to experience "emotional overload" after the US president lashed out at continuing strikes on Ukraine.

title.children: Trump realising Putin 'lies', Macron says, as Kyiv hit by record drone strikes

image.altText: A man wearing a suit is shoved in the face by a woman wearing a red jacket who is blocked by a door

props.synopsis: An Elysee official says a video which captures France's first lady pushing the president as they exit a jet in Vietnam shows the couple "having a laugh".

title.children: Emmanuel Macron downplays face shove from wife Brigitte as 'joking'

image.altText: A man rests his head on his chin as he looks to his side in a dimly-lit room.

props.synopsis: A profound schism is emerging between Liberals who want the party to move to the "sensible centre" and those who believe moderates are hijacking the devastating election loss to suit their agenda.

title.children: 'We've put off arguments … time to have it out': Liberals reveal deep divisions

image.altText: Parts of the Kempsey district are still under water following record flooding.

props.synopsis: Areas still recovering from last week's record floods are now bracing for gale-force winds, prompting concerns about falling trees.

title.children: 'Dangerous situation' as strong winds forecast for flood-stricken NSW

image.altText: police in bali hold a press conference showing bags of cocaine and a man under arrest with orange jumpsuit and black balaclava

props.synopsis: Police in Bali say 43-year-old Lamar Aaron Ahchee was arrested at the scene after allegedly picking up a package containing $1.1 million worth of cocaine hidden in chocolate wrappers.

title.children: Australian could face death penalty for allegedly smuggling 1.8kg of cocaine in Bali

image.altText: View looking through soccer goal at Abbeville Park

props.synopsis: A 46-year-old man has been charged after he allegedly grabbed a young boy by the neck at a junior soccer match in Perth's north.

title.children: Man charged for allegedly choking 11-year-old at junior soccer game

image.altText: Anthony Albanese press conference

props.synopsis: In some of his strongest criticism to date, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says Israel's "excuses and explanations" for blocking aid into Gaza are untenable, and that it is an outrage that a democratic state would withhold aid.

title.children: Albanese says Israel's 'excuses' for withholding Gaza aid not credible

image.altText: A young girl calling out desperately for food while holding a bucket, as others behind her also push forward.

props.synopsis: Jake Wood, executive director of the US-backed Gaza Humanitarian Foundation for the past two months, said he resigned as it could not adhere "to the humanitarian principles of humanity, neutrality, impartiality, and independence".

title.children: Head of US-backed Gaza aid foundation quits as further Israeli airstrikes kill dozens

image.altText: Waves splash up as a couple walk along a jetty

props.synopsis: Wild weather in South Australia sent waves splashing over jetties along the state's coastline as the Bureau of Meteorology warns people to "stay well away" from the dangerous surf.

title.children: Abormally high tide lashes South Australia's coastline, batters jetties

image.altText: A car submerged in water next to a dock.

props.synopsis: A couple celebrating their 57th wedding anniversary have had to be rescued after their car drove off a dock and into the water as they attempted to board a ferry in Tasmania.

title.children: 'Quick thinking' ferry staff praised after rescuing couple from submerged car

image.altText: Donald Trump wearing a blue suit and white MAGA hat, standing in front of Air Force One and multiple microphones

props.synopsis: The US President launches a new tirade against Russian President Vladimir Putin over massive drone and missile attacks on the Ukrainian capital, saying he is "needlessly killing a lot of people".

title.children: Trump rages in condemnation of Putin's massive attacks on Kyiv

image.altText: A ute on a road with a hazy orange sky.

props.synopsis: Police are directing traffic in Mildura as a dust storm sweeps over the regional Victorian city.

title.children: Mildura 'battens down the hatches' as dust storm takes over

image.altText: Rafael Nadal waves to fans at Roland Garros during a retirement ceremony.

props.synopsis: Fourteen-time French Open winner Rafael Nadal is honoured by the return of Roger Federer, Novak Djokovic and Andy Murray in an emotional ceremony at Roland-Garros.

title.children: 'Couldn't let you leave like that': Big Four reunite to honour Nadal

image.altText: Sally Fitzgibbons bending over after a surfing heat

props.synopsis: Sally Fitzgibbons has suffered heartbreak at the Margaret River Pro, losing her round-of-16 match-up in the final seconds, a result which has massive ramifications for the 34-year-old.

title.children: Fitzgibbons downed at Margaret River, with loss carrying major ramifications

image.altText: Callum Mills of the Swans reacts after a heavy tackle on Charlie Spargo of the Demons

props.synopsis: Callum Mills's long-awaited AFL comeback is on hold, with the Sydney captain to serve a one-game suspension for rough conduct.

title.children: Mills handed one-match ban for high bump on Demon

image.altText: A player holds the ball overhead and looks to make her next pass

props.synopsis: Although Super Netball team sizes have increased, the league's First Nations cohort has shrunk. As Wakka Wakka woman Leesa Mi Mi experiences the same isolation her sister Jemma did five years earlier.

title.children: Oh Mi Mi, Super Netball's Indigenous representation has shrunk

image.altText: GettyImages-1531628204

props.synopsis: The protest from Ireland's camogie players refusing to wear traditional skorts mirrors the discussion about whether netballers in Australia should still be mandated to wear skirts.

title.children: After camogie ditch skort requirement, could the netball dress be next?

image.altText: Firefighters swim in floodwaters pushing a bamboo raft of six dogs to safety.

props.synopsis: A rescue crew uses Hansel-and-Gretel-style tree markings, a makeshift bamboo raft and a lot of resourcefulness to save two people and six working dogs stranded by floodwaters in New South Wales.

title.children: Bamboo raft used to recover couple and dogs in dramatic flood rescue

image.altText: Front of Cairns Courthouse in far north Queensland in May 2018.

props.synopsis: A 41-year-old man is sentenced to 11 years in prison for the manslaughter of his great-nephew, who was found with severe injuries.

title.children: Queensland man jailed for killing toddler after 'significant' abuse

image.altText: Dozens of shoppers run towards the Northland exits.

props.synopsis: Two teenagers alleged to be the main offenders in a violent brawl between "rival gangs" at a Melbourne shopping centre were on bail at the time.

title.children: Two teens allegedly involved in Melbourne shopping centre brawl were on bail

image.altText: A man sitting at a conference table inside an office, in front of a large window, clasping his hands and looking serious.

props.synopsis: A workplace investigation into the NT's former corruption watchdog has found he gave "special and/or unwelcome attention to female employees".

title.children: 'A thing for pretty girls': NT ICAC workplace probe findings released

image.altText: Man smiling outside court

props.synopsis: The Independent NSW MP, who maintains his innocence, is accused of sexually assaulting a teen in 2013 and a man in 2015.

title.children: Sexual assault trial of NSW MP Gareth Ward begins in Sydney court

image.altText: A group of performers on stage with their right arm in the air.

props.synopsis: Olympic breaker Rachael 'Raygun' Gunn tried to shut down a musical about her — now a comedian has worked the legal row into her sold-out new show.

title.children: How a legal stoush with Raygun propelled this comedy musical to success

image.altText: A Starbucks logo is seen at a Starbucks coffee shop in Seoul

props.synopsis: Voters will head to the polls on June 3 following the impeachment of former president Yoon Suk Yeol for briefly declaring martial law in December.

title.children: Why Starbucks just banned these eight names in South Korea

image.altText: A top-down image showing a man's hands resting on the edge of an open Macbook laptop, as anotehr woman's hand points to a screen

props.synopsis: Donald Trump reveals plans to end the United States's Digital Equity Act, which provides funding to programs that assist people to live in an increasingly online world.

title.children: Trump slams 'racist' digital program teaching people to use computers

image.altText: The front entrance to the Perth Children's Court.

props.synopsis: A Kalgoorlie-Boulder teenager who stole two cars with children inside as their mothers tried desperately to stop him is sentenced to 15 months behind bars.

title.children: Teen jailed for leaving babies on roadside in extreme heat after stealing car

image.altText: A politician in a suit and tie speaking inside Parliament House.

props.synopsis: The state government has entered a court appeal with a businessman whose bid to build short-stay units in the Sunshine Coast hinterland failed to win council approval.

title.children: Queensland government backs LNP donor's court battle for luxury units

image.altText: A photo of a river that has broken its banks in Port Fairy with water under a table and chairs.

props.synopsis: The SES prepares sandbags as abnormally high tides threaten to flood low-lying coastal areas across Victoria.

title.children: Victoria's coast on alert amid flood threat from high tides

image.altText: Flood debris

props.synopsis: Deputy Commissioner Peter Thurtell says there will be an increased police presence in flood-affected areas after two men were charged with looting.

title.children: Two men charged with looting in flood-ravaged town of Taree

image.altText: A man in a tan suit and a woman dressed like a nun stare into a cockpit

props.synopsis: The Superbad and Juno star has finally stepped into the Wes Anderson universe... and he immediately steals the show.

title.children: Michael Cera was born to be in a Wes Anderson film
